comment:
I got to tell you, this new expression is above average and it is very drinkable. The first Blended Malt for the Chivas family, Ultis is a blend from 5 different malts (undisclosed but i bet one is strathisla).

On the nose, Pepper, Orange jam; Starts promising, some Stinky vanilla cream (like Johnnie Walker red label); a little Simple on the nose. Notes of Nuts coming after a sip.

On the palate... Water, at first. Then Spices like clove and pepper. Absolutely smooth. Very fancy. Elegant but not flavorfull. Second sip: caramel. Finish with ginger noges, short but pleasant.

Overall this is a bottle i would buy. My score for this, 89 over 100. Solid.

I just tried this blend last week and I have to say it's absolutely exquisite. The use of Longmorn whiskey really brings out the creaminess and I found I was wanting more after adding several drops of water. I found myself hoping that the Braeval and Allt'bhainne malts were available to buy as this whisky is really something special.
Slight smoky, med-full bodied, A tad spicy, sweet towards the end. Best China’s regal tasted so far
Smooth and fruity. I’m not a Chivas guy bit this is one Great scotch.
Honeyed and fruity notes, dried fruits too and some sherried sweetness, very easy to drink.

Not as good as Chivas 25

Disappointing for a blended malt

3.5/5

Dramfest `18. 1st Dram day two. Not bad for a blend 3.5 but on VFM at  nearly $190 a bottle that's a 3. However having now read the Distiller blurb I now realise I tried 5 of the remaining 20 scottish distilleries I had yet to try in one dram! Sadly I'm only counting it if it's a single malt so still at 20.

This is a crowd pleaser and just an amazing blend. Vanilla with ginger and spice and finishes well - nice ! I however still cannot justify the price 

Dan Murphy whisky tasting 13 sept 17
